page.title: 10FLITWICK MANOR.
page.content: FLITWICK MANOR IS MENTIONED IN THE 1086 DOMESDAY BOOK.THEN IT WAS HELD BY WILLIAM LOVET 'FROM THE KING',WHO DISPLACED THE SAXON THANE ALWIN. THE PRESENT MANOR HOUSE,BUILT IN THE 17TH CENTURY,WAS, UNTIL RECENTLY, A PRIVATE RESIDENCE. IN SEPTEMBER 1985 IT WAS OPENED AS A FINE RESTAURANT AND HOTEL. THE BEDROOMS, FURNISHED IN THE STYLE OF THE BUILDING,ARE NAMED AFTER OWNERS OR TENANTS OF THE MANOR,E.G.ANN FISHER AND EDWARD BLOFIELD. THE HOTEL HAS TWO MAIN DINING ROOMS, WITH A KITCHEN FOR EACH. THE DRAWING ROOM IS NOW A BAR AND THE LIBRARY IS USED FOR PRIVATE FUNCTIONS AND OTHER PURPOSES. IN THE GROUNDS THERE IS AN 18TH CENTURY GROTTO, A HA-HA, BEYOND WHICH THERE USED TO BE A DEER PARK, AND MANY VARIETIES OF TREES. THERE IS ALSO A MAN-MADE LAKE KNOWN AS FLITT WATER.
